org.wtc.eclipse.platform.locators
Class TreeItemPathLocator

java.lang.Object
  org.wtc.eclipse.platform.locators.TreeItemPathLocator

public class TreeItemPathLocator
extends java.lang.Object

Describes a node in a tree path to a TreeItem. TreeItemPathLocator objects can be chained to create a path to a TreeItem. This object can be used instead of TreeItemLocator if a finer-grained match of TreeItems is to be found. For example, if a tree exists: 

     + Root_1
         + MiddleUnique
             + ChildUnique <-- *select this [A]*
         + MiddleSame
             + Child
             + Child
             + Child
         + MiddleSame
             + Child
             + Child
             + Child  <-- *select this [B]*
     + Root_2
         + Child

If we want to select the node identified with "select this [A]" then there are two ways:

  1.      IUIContext ui = getUI();
     ui.click(new TreeItemLocator("Root_1/MiddleUnique/ChildUnique"));
     
  2.      IUIContext ui = getUI();
     TreeItemPathLocator nodePath
         = new TreeItemPathLocator("Root_1",
               new TreeItemPathLocator("MiddleUnique",
                   new TreeItemPathLocator("ChildUnique")));
     nodePath.findAndClick(ui);

But if we want to select the node identified with "select this [B]" then the TreeItemLocator must be used 

  1.      IUIContext ui = getUI();
     TreeItemPathLocator nodePath
         = new TreeItemPathLocator("Root_1",
               new TreeItemPathLocator("MiddleSame", 1
                   new TreeItemPathLocator("Child", 2)));
     nodePath.findAndClick(ui);

TreeItemPathLocator

public TreeItemPathLocator(java.lang.String labelPattern,
                           int index,
                           Tree parentTree,
                           TreeItemPathLocator child)
Describes a node in a tree path to a TreeItem.

Parameters:
labelPattern - - The text label as seen on the TreeItem or a regular expression that identifies the TreeItem by label. This parameter is optional. If null then find the first TreeItem matching the union of the other criteria
index - - The index of the TreeItem in its parent TreeItem (or Tree if this is a root node). This parameter is optional. If -1 then find the first TreeItem matching the union of the other criteria
parentTree - - The Tree widget containing this TreeItem. This parameter is optional. If null then find the first TreeItem matching the union of the other criteria (the first TreeItem as searched in all visible Tree widgets that match the other criteria will be found)
child - - The description of the child node to click, or null if this is the leaf node in the tree path that is to be clicked.
Method Detail

findAndClick

public void findAndClick(IUIContext ui)
                  throws WidgetSearchException
Walk the tree path described by this node: Click this node to select it then, if there is a child tree path node, expand this node and recurse into the child TreeItemPathLocator

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI-generated input
Throws:
WidgetSearchException - - If the TreeItem described by this tree item path cannot be found for any reason

findAndContextClick

public void findAndContextClick(IUIContext ui,
                                java.lang.String menuPath)
                         throws WidgetSearchException
Walk the tree path described by this node: Click this node to select it then, if there is a child tree path node, expand this node and recurse into the child TreeItemPathLocator. When the leaf node is found, context click the node and execute the menu action with the given menu item label

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI-generated input
menuItem - - The path to the menu item to select (can be a regular expression as described in the StringComparator utility)
Throws:
WidgetSearchException - - If the TreeItem described by this tree item path cannot be found for any reason
